name: Rocksmith 2014
notes: Important: You need to open Pulse audio volume control (pavucontrol) and in the configuration tab disable Rocksmith guitar adapter so the guitar cable gets connected. For the best latency do the following: - Change load-module module-udev-detect to load-module module-udev-detect tsched=0 in /etc/pulse/default.pa https://wiki.archlinux.org/index.php/PulseAudio/Troubleshooting#Glitches.2C_skips_or_crackling - Open Wine configuration, Audio tab, and instead of system default set your current audio output as your output device
content:
game:
  appid: 221680
installer:
- write_config:
    file: $GAMEDIR/Rocksmith.ini
    key: EnableMicrophone
    section: Audio
    value: 1
- write_config:
    file: $GAMEDIR/Rocksmith.ini
    key: Win32UltraLowLatencyMode
    section: Audio
    value: 0
- write_config:
    file: $GAMEDIR/Rocksmith.ini
    key: LatencyBuffer
    section: Audio
    value: 1
- write_config:
    file: $GAMEDIR/Rocksmith.ini
    key: ForceWDM
    section: Audio
    value: 0
- write_config:
    file: $GAMEDIR/Rocksmith.ini
    key: ForceDirectXSink
    section: Audio
    value: 0
- write_config:
    file: $GAMEDIR/Rocksmith.ini
    key: DumpAudioLog
    section: Audio
    value: 0
- write_config:
    file: $GAMEDIR/Rocksmith.ini
    key: Fullscreen
    section: Renderer.Win32
    value: 0
winesteam:
  Audio: alsa
  overrides:
    d3d11: disabled
    gameoverlayrenderer: builtin
  version: tkg-3.21-x86_64
